channel.title: Baltimore Riots - Thoughts?
channel.description:
Ready. Set. Go. Thoughts? Seeing as though it's flooding every news station in the United States (Not sure about anywhere else,) I'm curious as to how other people stand on the situation? Casual talk around these parts are split. Yeah, police brutality was, of course, a factor, but people always want to talk about how much of an upstanding gentlemen the victim was, who had a hefty arrest record at age 19, similar to Mike Brown, that being said, he didn't deserve to die. Then there are the rioters destroying their own town and homes, for what? CNN Newsroom released the 2014 statistics of people killed by police nationwide, and the amount of African Americans in opposition to Caucasian victims was not even close (414 Caucasian victims, 233 African Americans.) These situation always intrigue me, and so I'm curious as to what people who actually diagnose the situation intellectually think? Is race even an issue? How would the script flip if the roles were switched? Thoughts about the city of Baltimore's reaction? Social media exaggerates, obviously, and caters to extremities, not many people see whats going on behind the scenes and so we judge accordingly.
Then there are individual knuckleheads like this. [IMG]http://i60.tinypic.com/j6tytj.jpg[/img]
and people like this [IMG]http://i62.tinypic.com/vh4vvt.jpg[/img]
But, as I aforementioned, media exaggerates. Just curious as to what you all think.

item.title: Baltimore Riots - Thoughts?
item.dc:creator: @bowserjr2 Bowser jr
item.description:
@bowserjr2 wrote:

[quote=“CSharp95, post:11, topic:551310”]Bad things happen, mistakes are made, some people are horrible. It’s one thing to be angry about an unnecessary death at the hands of the police, it’s another to destroy private property and punish people who had nothing to do with the incident.
I don’t think police are powermad, nor do I think they’re angels. They’re people, and sometimes a person in that group of people will do something horrible and idiotic and everyone likes to pen it on all of the police in general.

I think the phrase “Everyone hates the police until it’s your house getting broken into” sums up my thoughts pretty well. Nobody I know enjoys being around people who are there to enforce the will of corrupt politicians, but everyone wants the service they provide because it’s necessary.

I’m not really sure what to think, I just wish people would get some sense. I can’t support any side in this issue since neither side has really done anything worth supporting.[/quote]
I don’t think people get to like the police better after someone break into your house.

Read full topic

item.title: Baltimore Riots - Thoughts?

@runerunerune wrote:

Some pretty sharp comments (excuse the pun(if that is actually a pun(I’m not sure)))
I agree in that I have no idea who’s side to take but anyone else think those n words got some classy , cool fashion for “violent thugs”

Read full topic

item.title: Baltimore Riots - Thoughts?
item.dc:creator: @CSharp95 CSharp95
item.description:
@CSharp95 wrote:

Bad things happen, mistakes are made, some people are horrible. It’s one thing to be angry about an unnecessary death at the hands of the police, it’s another to destroy private property and punish people who had nothing to do with the incident.
I don’t think police are powermad, nor do I think they’re angels. They’re people, and sometimes a person in that group of people will do something horrible and idiotic and everyone likes to pen it on all of the police in general.

I think the phrase “Everyone hates the police until it’s your house getting broken into” sums up my thoughts pretty well. Nobody I know enjoys being around people who are there to enforce the will of corrupt politicians, but everyone wants the service they provide because it’s necessary.

I’m not really sure what to think, I just wish people would get some sense. I can’t support any side in this issue since neither side has really done anything worth supporting.

Read full topic

item.title: Baltimore Riots - Thoughts?
item.dc:creator: @bowserjr2 Bowser jr
item.description:
@bowserjr2 wrote:

Nationality has nothing to do with which language you know. And the thing about Poles is just a joke, I’m not even British, it’s just Nigel Farage that is quite outspoken about them.

But seriously, immigration is the cause of all racial tension in US. If you can’t integrate immigrants and avoid them being second class citizens, you’re asking for problems.

Read full topic

item.description:
@Welliton_inc wrote:

Bowser jr:

This would never have happened if you didn’t let non-Brits enter your country.

Just want to know, if a Polish family for example came to the UK and had a child which learnt English as it’s first language etc, would you classify the child as British or Polish?
